intro: Amperea ericoides, commonly known as the dwarf heath, is a small evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It features compact, rounded foliage composed of small, leathery leaves that are typically dark green. The plant produces clusters of tiny, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Amperea ericoides is often used in rock gardens and as a ground cover due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
